column1: 2 ^ In Dòmino confído~; ¿~qŭómodo dícitis ánimaĕ meaĕ
column2: «~Tránsmigra in mòntem sicut passer~»~? ^ In the Lord I put my trust; how then do you say to my soul
column3: "Flee to the mountain like a sparrow"?

column1: 3 ^ Qŭóniam ecce peccatóres intendérunt arcum~; paravérunt saģìttas suas in farétra
column2: ut saģìttent in obscúro rectos corde. ^ For behold the wicked have bent their bow~; they have prepared their arrows in the quiver
column3: to shoot in the dark the upright of heart;
qŭid fecit~? ^ For the things which thou hast perfected
column4: they destroyed~; but what has the just man done?

column1: 5 ^ Dòminus in templo sancto suo~; Dòminus in caĕlo sedis ejus. Òculi ejus in páŭperem respìciunt~; palpébraĕ ejus intèrrogant fílios hòminum. ^ The Lord is in his holy temple
column2: the Lord's throne is in heaven. His eyes look on the poor man; his eyelids examine the sons of men.

column1: 6 ^ Dòminus intèrrogat justum et ìmpium~; qŭi aŭtem díliģit iniqŭitátem
column2: odit ánimam suam. ^ The Lord trieth the just and the wicked~; but he that loveth iniquity

column1: 7 ^ Pluet super peccatóres láqŭeos~; ìgnis et sùlfur
column3: pars cálicis eórum. ^ He shall rain snares upon sinners~; fire and brimstone
column5: shall be the portion of their cup.

column2: et justìțias diléxit~; aĕqŭitátem vîdit vùltus ejus. ^ For the Lord is just
column3: and hath loved justice; his countenance hath beheld righteousness.
